objtools.name: objtools
objtools.description: General utility functions for manipulating object.

ObjectMask.name: ObjectMask

classitems.description:
Determines whether a value is considered a scalar or an object.  Currently,
primitives plus Date types plus undefined and null plus functions are considered scalar.
classitems.name: isScalar

classitems.description: Checks for deep equality between two object or values.
classitems.name: deepEquals

classitems.description: Checks whether two scalar values (as determined by isScalar()) are equal.
classitems.name: scalarEquals

classitems.description:
Returns a deep copy of the given value such that entities are not passed
by reference.
classitems.name: deepCopy

params.name: obj
params.description: - The object or value to copy

classitems.description:
Given an object, converts it into a one-level-deep object where the keys are dot-separated
paths and the values are the values at those paths.
classitems.name: collapseToDotted

params.name: includeRedundantLevels
params.description:
- If set to true, the returned object also includes
keys for internal objects.  By default, an object such as { foo: { bar: "baz"} } will be converted
into { "foo.bar": "baz" }.  If includeRedundantLevels is set, it will instead be converted
into { "foo": { bar: "baz" }, "foo.bar": "baz" } .

params.name: stopAtArrays
params.description:
- If set to true, the collapsing function will not descend into
arrays.

example:
By default, an object such as { foo: [ "bar", "baz" ] } is converted
  into { "foo.0": "bar", "foo.1": "baz" }.  If stopAtArrays is set, this will instead be converted
  into { "foo": [ "bar", "baz" ] } .

classitems.description:
Returns whether or not the given query fields (in dotted notation) match the document
(also in dotted notation).  The "queries" here are simple equality matches.
classitems.name: matchDottedObject

params.name: query
params.description: - A one-layer-deep set of key/values to check doc for

return.description: - Whether or not the doc matches

classitems.description: Same as matchDottedObject, but allows for non-dotted objects and queries.
classitems.name: matchObject

params.name: doc
params.description: - Object to match against, in structured (not dotted) form

params.name: query
params.description: - Set of fields (either dotted or structured) to match

return.description: - Whether or not the object matches

classitems.description: Sets the value at a given path in an object.
classitems.name: setPath

classitems.description: Deletes the value at a given path in an object.
classitems.name: deletePath

return.description: - The object that was passed in

classitems.description: Gets the value at a given path in an object.
classitems.name: getPath

params.name: allowSkipArrays
params.description:
- If true: If a field in an object is an array and the
path key is non-numeric, and the array has exactly 1 element, then the first element
of the array is used.

classitems.description:
Returns a copy of the given object, but only including the fields allowed by
the mask.  If the maskedOutHook function is provided, it is called for
each field disallowed by the mask (at the highest level it is disallowed).
classitems.name: filterObject

params.name: maskedOutHook
params.description:
- Function to call for fields disallowed
by the mask

props.name: path
props.description: - Path on the object that was masked out

return.description:
- The object after removing masked out fields.  Note that
the returned object may still contain references to the original object.
Fields that are not masked out are copied by reference.

classitems.description: Returns a subsection of a mask given a dot-separated path to the subsection.
classitems.name: getSubMask

params.name: path
params.description: - Dot-separated path to submask to fetch

return.description: - Mask component corresponding to the path

classitems.description: Returns true if the given path is allowed by the mask.  false otherwise.
classitems.name: checkMaskPath

return.description: - Whether or not the given path is allowed

classitems.description: Returns the internal object that represents this mask.
classitems.name: toObject

classitems.description:
Combines two or more masks such that the result mask matches fields matched by
any of the combined masks.
classitems.name: addMasks

return.description: - The result of adding together the component masks

classitems.description:
Adds a set of masks together, but using a logical AND instead of a logical OR (as in addMasks).
IE, a field must be allowed in all given masks to be in the result mask.
classitems.name: andMasks

return.description: - The result of ANDing together the component masks

classitems.description: Check if a mask is valid in strict form (ie, it only contains objects and booleans)
classitems.name: validate

return.description: - Whether or not the mask is strictly valid

classitems.description: Returns an array of fields in the given object which are restricted by the given mask
classitems.name: getMaskedOutFields

return.description: - Paths to fields that are restricted by the mask

classitems.description:
Given a dot-notation mapping from fields to values, remove all fields that are not
allowed by the mask.
classitems.name: filterDottedObject

params.name: dottedObj
params.description: - Map from dotted paths to values, such as { "foo.bar": "baz" }

params.name: maskedOutHook
params.description: - Function to call for removed fields

props.name: path
props.description: - Path of the masked out field

classitems.description:
Returns an array of fields in the given object which are restricted by the given mask.  The
object is in dotted notation as in filterDottedObject()
classitems.name: getDottedMaskedOutFields

return.description: - Paths to fields that are restricted by the mask

classitems.description:
Given a structured document, ensures that
all fields are allowed by the given mask.  Returns true or false.
classitems.name: checkFields

classitems.description:
Given a dot-notation mapping from fields to values (only 1 level deep is checked),
ensure that all fields are in the (structured) mask.
classitems.name: checkDottedFields

params.name: dottedObj
params.description: - Mapping from dot-separated paths to values

classitems.description: Creates a structured mask given a list of fields that should be included in the mask.
classitems.name: createMaskFromFieldList

classitems.description: Returns a function that filters object fields based on a structured mask/whitelist.
classitems.name: createFilterFunc

return.description:
- A function(obj) that is the equivalent of calling filterObject()
on obj
